thread.title: Area children work out with the Cubs
thread.title_full: Area children work out with the Cubs

title: Area children work out with the Cubs
text:
Area children work out with the Cubs Area children work out with the Cubs Advocate Children's Hospital Saida Trznadel, 11, of Carpentersville, left, and Talia Freund, 14, of Mazon, wheel themselves off Sloan Field after a day hanging out with the Chicago Cubs. Saida Trznadel, 11, of Carpentersville, left, and Talia Freund, 14, of Mazon, wheel themselves off Sloan Field after a day hanging out with the Chicago Cubs. (Advocate Children's Hospital) Staff report Privacy Policy 
A group of nine Advocate Children's Hospital current and former patients, including Olivia Gryson, 8, of Elgin , Vanessa Hernandez, 7, of Bartlett, and Saida Trznadel, 11, of Carpentersville, along with their families, visited Cubs spring training in Mesa, Ariz. 
Advocate Health Care, American Airlines and the Chicago Cubs sponsored the trip, which included time playing ball on the field with Cubs players and autograph and photo sessions. 
"Wow! He's got a better swing than Rizzo!" Cubs pitcher Pedro Stop said of 10-year-old Kaden Beer, of Sterling, who hit four home runs off him. 
"He's going to remember that for the rest of his life," said his dad, Jeff Beer. 
Dr. Joanna Lewis, Advocate Children's Hospital pediatrician, along with a care team of nurses and child life specialists, joined the patients and their families. The 24-hour overnight trip included breakfast at the ballpark, a tour of Cubs Spring Training facilities and activities at the Advocate Kids Zone on Wednesday. Area children work out with the Cubs Advocate Children's Hospital Cubs infielder Addison Russell greets Vanessa Hernandez, 7, of Bartlett, an Advocate Children’s Hospital patient, at the Cubs training camp. Cubs infielder Addison Russell greets Vanessa Hernandez, 7, of Bartlett, an Advocate Children’s Hospital patient, at the Cubs training camp. (Advocate Children's Hospital)
